content: Yes, but it's a surgical process. If IMAP accounts, usually nothing, but POP accounts need a few steps to get all in sync. If the addressbook needs updating, that can be done as well. Provide real details on the components involved, which normally are message folders and addressbooks. Let us know.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thank you The original profile is a pop account. The second profile is imap, thinking that opening the pop profile would download the messages on the server. If that's true, could it be that easy?

But then there will be sent messages to move over, since they won't be on the server.

The address book does not need updating.
creator: atscomms

content: Yes, the POP account will download all messages. Is the intent to then remove the IMAP account? The sent messages on the POP account can be copied to the new POP profile if done prior to sending messages. If you have the old POP input folder, those can be merged into the new POP input folder. Clarify what you want and I'll try to give the details for that. My inference is that your goal is to restore the POP account and remove the IMAP account.
creator: davidsk

content:
That is correct. My goal is to update the original POP account and eliminate the imap account. That includes copying sent message from the imap account to the pop account.

Would that require creating a new pop account or can the original be updated?
creator: atscomms

content:
If you have the original profile, do this:

  1. click file>offline>download to ensure all IMAP messages are on PC (if menu bar not shown, press alt key first)
  2. click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profile folder' click 'open folder'
  3. you are now in profile, EXIT thunderbird
  4. click the imapmail folder and then the <IMAP account> folder
  5. COPY the sent file (ignore the sent.msf to another folder outside the profile
  6. Now, for safety, in case of a problem, copy the Profile entirely
    • backup one folder so that you are outside the profile folder
    • copy the profile itself to another safe place. We may never need it.
  7. now, click to the original profile with POP account. Open it and copy entirely
  8. return to the current profile folder and paste original profile contents to overly the current profile. you will be prompted to overwrite.
  9. Now, start thunderbird and, if the original profile was not corrupted in the disk problem, it should start.
  10. Next, install the addon, importexporttools NG
  11. highlight the POP account's sent folder, rightclick and select the import mbox option and then select the sent folder you copied earlier from the IMAP account.
  12. if all went well, you're done.
creator: davidsk

creator: siffemoz

content: Actually, we do care. Some of the problems you described may be outside Thunderbird's control, such as server connections or persons not receiving messages, but we do want to assist elsewhere. Many problems happen due to VPNs, antivirus products, addons that are not working in updated releases. If you feel you are frequently hit with problems, a conservative approach would be to go to settings and set the update feature to notify, but not automatically update. If you are on the monthly release, you may be more comfortable with the ESR release. Be sure to create backups occasionally to avoid catastrophic problems. If you are experiencing a problem, please post it and someone may have suggestions. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

Inoltre puoi riporta le impostazionie che hai in Menu > Impostazioni account > NOME_ACCOUNT > Spazio su disco (se l'account è POP3) o in Menu > Impostazioni account > NOME_ACCOUNT > Sincronizzazione e archiviazione (se l'account è IMAP) ?
creator: @next

content: Est-ce que la relève de message fonctionne si tu démarres TB en "mode de dépannage" (maintenir un appui sur la touche Maj tout en lançant TB) ? En mode "normal" Thunderbird affiche-t-il un message d'erreur lors des relèves automatiques ou manuelles ? Le cas échéant, lequel ? Après démarrage de TB aller au menu Outils et ouvrir la fenêtre "Activités" : quel est son contenu ? Dans le menu Outils aller aussi à Outils de développement > Console d'erreurs : y a-t-il des lignes d'erreurs en rouge ?
creator: Mapenzi

content: If this is an IMAP account, it's not unusual. Thunderbird periodically saves the draft (depending on settings) and when message is sent, the last used draft is deleted - but that may leave several older copies to be manually removed. This is not a new issue. It usually surfaces for a user when spending a lot of time drafting a message.
creator: davidsk

content:
• I didn't add the URL for notmuch for those who don't know what that is: https://notmuchmail.org/
  • The syntax I used comes from gmail, but any other syntax would be great! I search for email dozens of times a day, I don't want to go through the advanced search UI (attached)!
creator: camachorod

content:
Thunderbird doesn’t support Gmail-style search syntax directly, but you have a few solid options:

• Search Messages (Ctrl+Shift+F) lets you combine From, To, Subject, and Date across All Folders. • Saved Searches (Virtual Folders) allow you to reuse complex queries. • Server-side search (e.g., Gmail web) is still the most powerful and reliable for advanced operators. • Local tools like notmuch remain the best choice for fast, scriptable power-user searches.

Native syntax like from:XXX subject:"foo" after:20d isn’t available yet, but these methods cover most needs.
creator: henryjameswork.123

content:
Henry James said
Thunderbird doesn’t support Gmail-style search syntax directly, but you have a few solid options: • Search Messages (Ctrl+Shift+F) lets you combine From, To, Subject, and Date across All Folders. • Saved Searches (Virtual Folders) allow you to reuse complex queries. • Server-side search (e.g., Gmail web) is still the most powerful and reliable for advanced operators.


Although I appreciate that you can get the same results through different means, when you search through your email dozens of times a day for very different things, it's super important to be able to do it quickly.

• Local tools like notmuch remain the best choice for fast, scriptable power-user searches.

If it was possible to view and interact with the resulting emails from a notmuch search in Thunderbird, I would build this solution for myself! Do you know how to do that??

Native syntax like from:XXX subject:"foo" after:20d isn’t available yet, but these methods cover most needs.

Is this part of the roadmap?
creator: camachorod

La causa più comune per l'errore PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR è un software antivirus o simile che si interpone tra Thunderbird e la rete. Controllerei anzitutto questo.

Più in generale, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content: You received a response three posts back, but you never responded. That individual was prepared to assist you in your issue. Thunderbird is a messenger; it receives messages back from the network and shares those with the user. That is why you see the message. That your ISP keeps changing the specs should be a concern to you, as it's their system. Maybe, if you post exact error message, screenshot of the certificate, screenshot of the incoming server settings pane, someone here will have suggestions. thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
This is a web forum, not a mailing list. Replies to your query will show up on this very site. Notification email goes to the email address registered for your account. When you can't receive messages sent to that account, watch this space.

If you lost your account password, check with your email provider for password recovery options.
